text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pickled pepper onion relish
starring Peppadew peppers that's right
you remember the old song Peppadew
peppers on't pepper will pepper won't
but anyway during our mini philly
cheesesteak video i promise to show you
this super simple and very delicious
relish and by the way even if you're not
going to make the miniature cheesesteaks
you should still pay attention as this
stuff is very versatile and delicious
with so many other things so let's go
ahead and get started and believe it or
not there's only like three main
ingredients so first and most
importantly we need some pickled cherry
peppers I'm also going to use a couple
jalapeno and some onion of course and
while this trick should work with any
kind of pickled cherry peppers if you
can you really want to try to find the
Peppadew because the Peppadew peppers
and the pickling liquid they come in
work perfectly for this technique and by
the way I'll give a lot more info on
your pepper choices on the blog so what
we're going to do is just cut those in
half and kind of slice them into strips
like this and one big tip when you're
slicing peppers that have already been
pickled or processed you always want to
slice through the flesh side first and
then through the skin okay pepper skin
is very tough so if you try to slice
through that first you can easily smash
the flesh of the pepper and it won't
work as well and once we've done that
we'll turn it and cut it into a nice
small dice and by the way I mentioned it
earlier but do not discard any any of
that liquid that came packed with the
peppers we are going to use some of that
so don't throw it away and then of
course we're going to do the same thing
to our jalapeno and once our peppers
have been finely diced we're going to do
the same thing to an onion and once that
stuff's prepped we're going to head over
to the stove where we will put a skillet
on medium-high heat and drizzle in a
little bit of vegetable oil not butter
not olive oil all right for relishes
we're going to serve at room temperature
cold vegetable oil is your best bet
because it doesn't thicken or get cloudy
when it gets cold and then to that pan
let's go ahead and add our onions along
with our jalapeno along with the
traditional large generous pinch of salt
and what we'll do is we'll cook that
stirring for a few minutes until those
onions just just barely start to turn
translucent and soften a little bit
we don't want soft sweet caramelized
onions we still want something that has
a little bit of bite to it but we do
want to take away that sharp edge from
the onions
so we'll cook those stirring until they
look something like this at which point
we will dump in our dice Peppadew
peppers and and this is the key to the
whole operation about 1/4 cup of the
pickling brine we're just going to dump
that in we're going to give it a stir
and we're going to turn off the heat
all right we don't need to cook this
anymore we're just going to heat those
Peppadew peppers through and those
pickling juices are just going to reduce
ever so slightly from the residual heat
in the pan so just pour it in
turn off the heat give it a stir and in
just a minute or two you should have
something that looks like this and that
believe it or not is pretty much done
you may have to add a pinch of salt but
probably not like I said that liquid the
peppers are packed in is super flavorful
and really should provide all the
seasoning you need so at this point we
can go ahead and transfer that into some
kind of container to cool and then once
that's cool
you are ready to start enjoying it on
anyone of so many different delicious
things of course you probably saw it
used in our mini Philly cheesesteaks but
besides that it's also amazing on a
hotdog or sausage or pile down a
cheeseburger or maybe scattered over
some nachos except now the only problem
is I want nachos but anyway that's it
super quick super easy pickled pepper
and onion relish and I know compared to
a real pickled pepper relish we're kind
of cheating here using the peppadews and
the pickling liquid that came with it
but hey it works and it's very delicious
besides as my friends in New England are
always telling me if you're not cheating
you're not trying alright so I really do
hope you give this a try head over to
food wishes comm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
